summary:
Aramaic is an ancient Semitic language from the Middle East. It was widely used over 3,000 years ago in places like Syria, Mesopotamia, and Arabia for administration and religion. Today, some people still speak modern Aramaic in Syria and other regions. It is also used in churches and Jewish, Samaritan, and Mandaean religious practices.

Aramaic is related to languages like Hebrew and Phoenician. Its alphabet, derived from the Phoenician one, influenced the creation of the Hebrew and Arabic alphabets. Unfortunately, many Aramaic dialects are now endangered, with efforts to document them before they disappear.
title: Aramaic
